text: What factors do you have to consider to design a simulation? Suppose you run your simulation 20 times. How does proportional reasoning help you report your estimated theoretical probability as a ratio or percent?

To design a simulation, you need to choose a tool that can represent the number of outcomes for an event. You need to know the number of occurrences for each outcome.

If you run a simulation 20 times you can scale up the results to any ratio or out of 100 to get the probability written as a percent.
